Onion prices to drop in 3-4 days; steps taken to boost pulse productionThe red onion crop is already reaching Nashik mandi and onions from Alwar are set to arrive in Delhi and other northern markets by Tuesday.

Sensex, Nifty rebound sharply as financial stocks gain amid volatilityThe NSE Nifty 50 rose 217.95 to end at 24,213.3, while the BSE Sensex gained 694.39 points, closing at 79,476.63. Both benchmarks had fallen by about 0.6% during the session before a strong rally in the final hours of trading.

Stock market crash: Adani Ports, Reliance, Bajaj Auto among top losers Market crash: The bloodbath on Dalal Street can be attributed to a combination of factors, including a disappointing Q2 earnings season, heightened caution ahead of the upcoming US presidential elections, and persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).
US presidential elections cause market turbulence as investors grow waryThe US elections are affecting the share market, with significant impacts on bond yields and investor caution.

Panic grips Dalal Street: 4 factors behind today's stock market crashStock market today: Both benchmark indices fell as much as 2%, leading to massive losses for investors. At 12:57 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,303.19 points at 78,420.93, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 437.15 points to trade at 23,867.20.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trump leads but Kamala Harris narrows gap, he stays ahead in swing statesUS Election Result 2024: Republican Donald Trump takes a strong lead with projected wins in 23 states, securing 214 electoral votes. Vice President Kamala Harris is hot on his heels with 179 electoral votes as the results roll in.

Live: Trump wins North Carolina, ahead in 5 swing states; leads Harris by 230-179 votesUS Presidential Election Result Live Updates: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, the two contenders for the 2024 US presidential election, wrapped up their electoral campaigns on Monday night, paving the way for Americans to cast their ballots in one of the most anticipated polls in the country. While Trump, the Republican contender, is attempting to win a second stint at the White House, Harris -- the incumbent Vice President and Democratic nominee -- is vying to create history by becoming first female President of the US. The 7 battleground states of Arizona, Nevada, Georgia, North Carolina, Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania will play a key role in deciding the fate of Harris and Trump. The two will need at least 270 electoral votes to win the presidency. Voting began at 4.30 pm (IST) on Tuesday and will continue until around 6.30 am (IST) on Wednesday morning. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates on the presidential election.

Ballot measure to overturn abortion ban rejected in Florida, passed in 3 statesThe Florida measure failed to clear the required 60% voter approval threshold to pass constitutional amendments in Florida. Most states require a simple majority.

Netanyahu fires Israel Defence Minister Yoav Gallant over 'crisis of trust'Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed Defence Minister Yoav Gallant over a "crisis of trust" and appointed Foreign Minister Israel Katz to succeed him as the new Defence Minister.

Shalini Passi's secret diet for that skin, hair, teeth: A shot of ghee and goat curdFrom numerous juices and soups to goat curd, Shalini Passi's diet is as bold and vibrant as her larger-than-life personality. The Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives star tells all in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital.

Live: Trump-Harris headed for a battle that may go down the wirePennsylvania Election Results 2024: With 19 electoral votes, Pennsylvania becomes the critical battleground for Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Kamala Harris. This Rust Belt seat is the largest and most hotly contested of the swing states, pivotal for both candidates' paths to the White House. Trump's return campaign has focused on revitalising his 2016 strategies that secured wins in key states, while Harris has aimed to solidify the Democratic stronghold established by President Joe Biden in 2020. As the nation watches closely for the outcome, stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring all the latest from Pennsylvania.
Kamala Harris wins California which has most number of electoral college votes, report US networksKamala Harris wins California which has most number of electoral college votes, report US networks

Singer Sharda Sinha's death: Son grieves, informs funeral to take place in PatnaSinger Sharda Sinha died on November 5 at Delhi's AIIMS Hospital. Her son, Anshuman, shared that her funeral will be held in Patna.

When will we know who has won?US election results 2024: While November 5 may be Election Day, a final picture could take days or weeks to emerge due to the neck-and-neck contest between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump. Here is a complete guide.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Harris vs Trump: Who is leading in 7 swing states as battle intensifies?Kamala Harris was leading in the swing state of Pennsylvania since the results started coming out. However, she lost the lead to Trump, who is now ahead by roughly two percentage points.

Over 70% US voters say American democracy under threat, exit poll revealsAccording to national exit poll data from Edison Research, nearly 75% of voters in Tuesday's presidential election between Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump viewed American democracy as under threat.

In a rare show of strength, Hindus and Sikhs gathered in solidarity and protested, by blocking roads and sloganeering.

Donald Trump wins North Carolina, first of seven swing statesNorth Carolina Election Result 2024 Live Updates: The 2024 presidential election in North Carolina has been a highly anticipated contest between Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and Democratic nominee Kamala Harris. As a pivotal battleground state with 16 electoral votes, North Carolina's outcome is crucial in influencing the overall election results. Trump's campaign has centred on the economy, immigration, and crime, while Harris has emphasised strengthening the care economy, protecting abortion rights, and defending democratic values. Stay tuned for more updates on IndiaToday.in.

Navratilova reacts to 'leaked medical report'Media reports alleged that Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, a Paris Olympics champion, is biologically male based on leaked medical findings. The reports claim Khelif possesses XY chromosomes and male anatomical characteristics, sparking renewed debate about her eligibility to compete in women's boxing.

ICC successfully trials AI tool to curb abuse in women's cricket The ICC has completed a ground-breaking AI-powered social media moderation trial to eliminate abuse in the women's game. The trial was conducted during the T20 Women's World Cup in the UAE.

Djokovic withdraws from ATP Finals with 'ongoing injury'  Novak Djokovic has withdrawn from the upcoming ATP Finals 2024 in Turin after he failed to recover from an 'ongoing injury'. Djokovic also did not take part in the Paris Masters.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
